title: Microsoft open-sources 3D Movie Maker, its animation program from the 90s
content:
Microsoft has open-sourced the code for 3D Movie Maker, an animation program it had originally released in 1995. If you don’t remember 3D Movie Maker, that’s understandable, seeing as it was a relatively short-lived piece of software. 3D Movie Maker was an animation studio geared towards children, and it gave users the ability to create

The post Microsoft open-sources 3D Movie Maker, its animation program from the 90s appeared first on XDA.
description: Microsoft has announced that the code for its 1995 animation program 3D Movie Maker is now open-source and available on GitHub.
